titles: By the Queene. The Queenes Maiestie being of late time infourmed by the ambassadour here resident for her good brother the kyng of Spayne, that sundry euyll disposed [and] rebellious people inhabitauntes within the sayd kynges lowe countries had come into this her realme, and from thence were secretly returned into the sayde lowe countries, where they dyd commit many robberyes, spoyles, and murders ...
author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1558-1603 : Elizabeth I)
publisher: In Powles Churchyarde, by Richarde Iugge and Iohn Cawood, Printers to the Queenes Maiestie,
notes: A proclamation against relieving the King of Spain's rebels.
At foot of sheet: Cum priuilegio Regi√¶ Maiestatis.
Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.
